column4: why does ubuntu use these funny UUID labels instead of /dev/sdb1 for instance?
The UUID-based fstab is an improvement because it lets you rename your devices without breaking the fstab. You can change it to be the old way if you like, but I don't recommend it.
There are reasons to want to rename devices - why do you want to edit your fstab?
To destructively format a partition, I suggest using dd to copy a massive amount of /dev/urand to fill the whole partition, then shredding the resulting file, then doing a normal format.
